paragraphs.content: Oh that thou wouldest rend the heavens, that thou wouldest come down, that the mountains might flow down at thy presence,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Oh that thou wouldest rend the heavens, that thou wouldest come down, that the mountains might flow down at thy presence,

paragraphs.content: As when the melting fire burneth, the fire causeth the waters to boil, to make thy name known to thine adversaries, that the nations may tremble at thy presence!
paragraphs.contentHtml: As when the melting fire burneth, the fire causeth the waters to boil, to make thy name known to thine adversaries, that the nations may tremble at thy presence!

paragraphs.content: When thou didst terrible things which we looked not for, thou camest down, the mountains flowed down at thy presence.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When thou didst terrible things which we looked not for, thou camest down, the mountains flowed down at thy presence.

paragraphs.content: For since the beginning of the world men have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither hath the eye seen, O God, beside thee, what he hath prepared for him that waiteth for him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For since the beginning of the world men have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither hath the eye seen, O God, beside thee, what he hath prepared for him that waiteth for him.

paragraphs.content: Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness, those that remember thee in thy ways: behold, thou art wroth; for we have sinned: in those is continuance, and we shall be saved.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness, those that remember thee in thy ways: behold, thou art wroth; for we have sinned: in those is continuance, and we shall be saved.

paragraphs.content: But we are all as an unclean thing, and all our righteousnesses are as filthy rags; and we all do fade as a leaf; and our iniquities, like the wind, have taken us away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But we are all as an unclean thing, and all our righteousnesses are as filthy rags; and we all do fade as a leaf; and our iniquities, like the wind, have taken us away.

paragraphs.content: And there is none that calleth upon thy name, that stirreth up himself to take hold of thee: for thou hast hid thy face from us, and hast consumed us, because of our iniquities.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And there is none that calleth upon thy name, that stirreth up himself to take hold of thee: for thou hast hid thy face from us, and hast consumed us, because of our iniquities.

paragraphs.content: But now, O LORD, thou art our father; we are the clay, and thou our potter; and we all are the work of thy hand.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But now, O Lord, thou art our father; we are the clay, and thou our potter; and we all are the work of thy hand.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Be not wroth very sore, O LORD, neither remember iniquity for ever: behold, see, we beseech thee, we are all thy people.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Be not wroth very sore, O Lord, neither remember iniquity for ever: behold, see, we beseech thee, we are all thy people.

paragraphs.content: Thy holy cities are a wilderness, Zion is a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy holy cities are a wilderness, Zion is a wilderness, Jerusalem a desolation.

paragraphs.content: Our holy and our beautiful house, where our fathers praised thee, is burned up with fire: and all our pleasant things are laid waste.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Our holy and our beautiful house, where our fathers praised thee, is burned up with fire: and all our pleasant things are laid waste.

paragraphs.content: Wilt thou refrain thyself for these things, O LORD? wilt thou hold thy peace, and afflict us very sore?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wilt thou refrain thyself for these things, O Lord? wilt thou hold thy peace, and afflict us very sore?
